description:
I have used the software for about 3 month now and have not found any red flags so far, for me at least. No craches or problems of that sort on ubuntu 22.04. A good tool to sync passwords between devices.

But there is one thing to note. The autolock is not working at all on my desktop. So if I unlock the vault and leave it open while lock my desktop and keep the computer running for good amount of time like houers or even days, then when I log back in to my account, the vault is still unlocked. So the timeout within the software (mine set til 15min) does not work. 

So if this is one of those red flags or not for you is up to you to deside. But in the meen time you can lock it manualy by ctrl + L before locking the computer.
Unable to export .csv

Blank white screen with Ubuntu 22.04.4 LTS Intel Core i5 7th Gen
Poor compatability with Firefox on Ubuntu :( sad days
Been using for a couple of months, at first it was a little unstable, but it is quickly improving.
Not that stable though
Only 4 people reviewed this? I'll review after I try this out. 3 stars to start just because Nord is a fairly popular VPN provider, aren't they?
Used since release, no problems
It's a great PM even though it still lacks some features, but it's quickly improving

The app does not work on Ubuntu 20.10 Wayland getting the following.

12:32:06.441 › Starting app: Version: 2.13.7; OS: linux x64 5.8.0-25-generic; args: --no-sandbox
Error org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.Failed: cannot set "default-url-scheme-handler" setting to invalid value "nordpass"
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
This works flawlessly. As people mentioned, even though it lacks some feature the App is quickly improving !
New features are added weekly, or less, bugs are crushed fast. In one year or more, this will be a very awesome app, more than it is.
summary: Awesome and very up to date app

description: It works great on Ubuntu20.04+ and even on wayland. I used lastpass before but it now forces users to pick only one type of device. So I dicthed LastPass for Nordpass. It has all the free feature Lastpass has.
summary: One of the best password manager

description: thanx for this tools
You can not set a master password without a Nord accunt.
a propriatary software highlighted in the app store??? use pass or keepass please.
summary: nonfree software highlighted in the shop???

description: It's propietary and it has no open source code and it asks for a nord account. Use keepassxc which is free and it's open source.
bad principle: by definition proprietary is not open source
summary: Is this the tend for open source, to get paid for references?

description: nice app tjanks
its not open source and is still promoted on the store. Use BitWarden or Keepass instead

* Nordvpn was hacked in 2020 and lost several internal keys. They are not reliable and secure.
* It is a closed-source solution, hosted in USA

Why is this even promoted here?

Why is this promoted here?
It's proprietary software hosted in a cloud somewhere. NordVPN, the developer of this was hacked in 2019.

Use KeePassXC or Bitwarden, not this!
Glad this works well on Linux and I didn't spend time importing all my logins on my Windows comp yesterday for nothing.
user_display: Mk Ultra Budz - Normal Sofaking + What is this Login

description: very good locker for passwords
Works well, like on my windows machine or the mobile apps.
They constantly improve it.
Amazing tool for password management
I cannot login into the App. It does not give an error either. It's just opening the browser but then jumps back to the start screen instead of logging in, after succesful login in the browser.

Worked during the past month so so, unstable

Now unable to log in. No error, nothing
It seems to run OK, but when I attempt to import passwords from Chrome, it times out. When going to their website to do anything, it can't detect my browswer and tells me to come back later.
It used to work in 20.04, but after upgrading to 22.04 it does no longer work.
The latest verion works with Ubuntu 22.04. Giving it 4/5 stars because this version doesn't support biometric auth. I'd like fingerprint auth (using a Thinkpad).
3.3 looks like bums.
Love that Nord rolled this out for linux! Great features, aesthetically pleasing, intuitive, and secure. Wish you could password protect selected entries for added peace of mind.
summary: Feature rich password manager app for linux

description:
Sometimes app freezes, shows password prompt several times on the same site.
It happens to launch automatically, without any action from the user.
summary: Good Password Manager, but poor experience on Ubuntu

description: This thing is as useless as it gets. Worked fine (after a lot of back andd forth with support) on Mint 21 and now on 21.1 it won't start. I am done with this PM.
LastPass never did this

I'm running Linux Mint 21.1 and have tried installing Nordpass a number of ways. Via the software store (flatpak), the install kept crashing, similar anomalies with the .deb from Nordpass' website. Using the snap from the snap store, it seems to be working (mostly) flawlessly but the trayicon is broken. Albeit quite annoying, given the other options, I can live with it but seems like it should be a simple fix (shrugs)
summary: Working very well but trayicon is broken

description:
Nordpass works pretty well on my phone (iphone) and on even better on my notebook (windows). Unfortunetly the linux version is filled with bugs. Specially when I create a new account in a website, nordpass fill the password field but freezes before storing it. 

It happens every single time.
I don't know if it's only a problem for me on my PC, but every time I add new passwords my OS crashes and I have to restart it, what's more the new password is not even added

The app itself is nice, and there are no obvious problems.

However, when I try to update the app from snap, I face an error that I can't done it because of the run processes.

I need to shutdown NordPass on my own or somtimes restart the laptop and quit the NordPass on the startup to be able to update the app from snap.

Please investigate this problem and fix it, since this is the most painful part on Ubuntu.

The security on offer is second to none but it comes at the cost of usability or just typing in your password all the bloody time.

Everytime you restart your computer, pass please...

Come back from sleep, pass please...

Been longer than a few hours on your machine, pass please...

It is highly annoying that one of the features is to ask you for your password so often. Yes it is secure, but no it is not user friendly and I know those two things conflict with one another. I clearly fall on the side of user friendliness.

Other than that the manager does everything and more for you. notes, passkeys, passwords... it has it all. one stop shop for everything as well with VPN provided as a coimbined account. Very useful app to have and the Linux support is brilliant too.
summary: Great security but a bit annoying

description: great app - Thanks for making a Linux version!
on a fresh ubuntu 22.04.3 install, after installing nordpass through snap, the application just does not launch at all
One of the best password managers. Economical as well!
Am Anfang funktionierte das Programm recht gut. Später traten dann zunehmend "Schikanen" auf und jetzt sogar eine ganz deutliche Ansage durch ein Pop-Up bis Januar
Hat des öfteren Macken und benötigt eine Internetverbindung.
I realy like this password manager, simple, easy to use, and Linux support.
Genial cumplio espectativas
perfect, thanks for developping it
Dommage que cette application ne soit pas open source. Un manque de transparence de NordVPN.

Vraiment super app une fois maitrisée ! Le seul bémol : En cas de plantage complet du pc (ou smartphone) si on pert le mot de passe maître ou la clé de récupération, impossible de récupérer quoique ce soit "gratuitement" ! ça m'est arrivé une fois (avec plantage plus perte des sauvegardes), et Nordvpn m'a "royalement" récupéré mon compte, mais la prochaine fois, ce sera payant !! (alors que j'ai la version payante !...)
